statement.p: Nandi is conducting market research on the cost of auto insurance. Nandi has determined that the average annual cost of auto insurance is 968, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 98.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 905 on auto insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 40 of auto insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 20 of auto insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 40 of the data, need the remaining 60 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution.
